abstract: Southeastern Asset Management, the money manager that fought the buyout of Dell, has taken a 12 percent voting stake in the News Corporation, making it the second-largest investor behind Rupert Murdoch.
snippet: Southeastern Asset Management, the money manager that fought the buyout of Dell, has taken a 12 percent voting stake in the News Corporation, making it the second-largest investor behind Rupert Murdoch.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:52 p.m. | Southeastern Asset Management, the money manager that fought the buyout of Dell, has taken a 12 percent voting stake in News Corporation, making it the second-largest investor behind the company’s chairman, Rupert Murdoch.

headline.main: Money Manager Takes Big Stake in News Corp.
headline.print_headline: Money Manager Takes Big Stake in News Corp.
